intro: Mabea rubrinervis, commonly known as the red-veined mabea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Mabea rubrinervis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant foliage and attractive blooms.
